Package com.fdm.model

Class Map

java.lang.Object
com.fdm.model.Map
@Component
@Entity
public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
Class of Map data, allows for generation of map UTF-8 files
Version:
1.0
Author:
KILA

    • Map

      public Map()

    • Map

      public Map​(java.lang.String mapName)
      Construct a map without actors Overload of Map(String, List)
      Parameters:
      mapName - the name of the text file to read

    • Map

      public Map​(java.lang.String mapName, java.util.List<Actor> actors)
      Construct a map with actors
      Parameters:
      mapName - the name of the text file to read
      actors - the actors who will immediately exist on the map

  • Method Details

    • updateVisibleMap

      public void updateVisibleMap()
      Updates the console visible map which is a char[][]

    • updateVisibleStringMap

      public void updateVisibleStringMap()
      Updates the web visible map which contains strings The strings include html tags to allow for styling

    • getStringMap

      public java.lang.String[][] getStringMap()
      Gets the string map for display in html It will generate the map if it does not exist
      Returns:
      the string map generated by updateVisibleStringMap() it contains html tags for styling

    • getxMax

      public int getxMax()
      Returns:
      the number of x points on the map

    • getyMax

      public int getyMax()
      Returns:
      the number of y points on the map

    • generateMapFile

      public static void generateMapFile​(int xMax, int yMax, java.lang.String title)
      Generates a txt file with utf-8 encoding of a map The map will be default generated with walls on the outside and dots on the inside
      Parameters:
      xMax - - number of x points for the map to generate
      yMax - - number of y points for the map to generate
      title - - the name of the map

    • readMapFromFile

      public void readMapFromFile()
      Overload for readMapFromFile(String) Reads the default map

    • readMapFromFile

      public void readMapFromFile​(java.lang.String mapName)
      Loads the map in the folder/mapName and sets the attributes of this map to those values
      Parameters:
      mapName - - name of map to read in

    • printMap

      public void printMap()
      Prints the char[][] in viewMap to console

      Add actor to map
      Parameters:
      actor - to add

    • remove

      public void remove​(int id)
      Remove actor from map if they are present
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • updateActors

      public void updateActors()
      Update list of actors This removes any actors who have died

      public java.util.List<Actor> getEnemies()
      Get enemies
      Returns:
      the actors who are instances of Enemy

    • getMapCharacters

      public char[][] getMapCharacters()
      Get the current visible map Will generate the visible map if it doesn't exist
      Returns:
      the char[][] map for console use without formatting

    • isBlocked

      public boolean isBlocked​(int x, int y)
      Function to tell if the coordniate [x,y] is accessible
      Parameters:
      x - - the x coordinate
      y - - the y coordinate
      Returns:
      boolean true if the tile is inaccessible, false if accessible

    • tryMoveActor

      public boolean tryMoveActor​(Actor actor, Direction dir)
      Function for a character to try and move on this map Moving into an enemy will instead attack them
      Parameters:
      actor - to move
      dir - Direction to move in
      Returns:
      a boolean for if the move was successful. Will return true if an enemy was attacked

    • validTiles

      public java.util.List<Coord> validTiles()
      Function to find all allowable spawn locations
      Returns:
      a List of Coords ([x,y] pairs) where Actors can be spawned
